intro: Erythranthe moniliformis, commonly known as the clustered monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as stream banks and meadows. It has hairy, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Erythranthe moniliformis is often found in California and Oregon, where it thrives in cool, humid environments.
